subject: Technology
title: HDTV and Flat Screens
description: Learn HDTV and Flat Screens in one minute.

hook.text: The jump from standard definition to high definition was like putting on glasses for the first time. Everything got sharper.

buildup.text: HDTV offered five times more detail than standard TV. Suddenly you could see individual blades of grass on a football field.

discovery.text: Flat-screen TVs using LCD and plasma technology replaced bulky CRTs. A 50-inch screen could now hang on a wall.

twist.text: HD was so detailed that TV hosts needed better makeup. News anchors' wrinkles and flaws became visible for the first time.

climax.text: 4K and 8K TVs now offer resolution beyond what the human eye can distinguish at normal viewing distances.

punchline.text: TVs got so sharp that we ran out of details for the eye to see.

quiz.question: What unexpected consequence did HDTV have on television production?
options: On-screen talent needed better makeup due to visible details
